todos.title: Nouns / Who specifically or what specifically
todos.body: When someone says “they don’t understand us”  make sure you ask “who specifically doesn’t understand you”.  Why?

todos.title: How over why
todos.body: Why question get you reasons and excuses, how gets you to solutions.

todos.title: Too Much / Too Many / Too Expensive / Compared to What
todos.body: When someone says that something is “too..” something then ask them compared to what.  What are the other alternatives.

todos.title: NLP Outcome Questions
todos.body: What do I want, what is the objective, what am I here for, what do I want for you, what do I want for me.

todos.title: Verbs / How Specifically
todos.body: If someone says they are depressed, ask them how specifically they are depressed.  Drill deeper into the meaning.

todos.title: But
todos.body: Avoid using this word, it imposes contradiction.   Instead say, that’s true and here’s something else that’s true.  I appreciate and, I respect and, I agree and…Try to get two people to take opposing sides without using the word but.

todos.title: Avoid Projected Stories or Verbal Mind Reading
todos.body: Avoid things like   I know they will like it or I know he hates me.

todos.title: Universals / All, Every, Never
todos.body: Avoid making universal statements unless you can guarantee they are true.

todos.title: Should/Shouldn’t/Must/Can’t / What would happen if you were to do that
todos.body: Avoid limiting signals by asking what if you were to do that.

todos.title: Outcome Framing
todos.body: Avoid asking people what’s bothering them or what’s wrong.  You will get a long description of the problem.  Instead ask them, what do you want, or how do you want things to change.  You will redirect things from a problem to a solution.
